snippet: In roughly 130 pieces of correspondence to her brother, Constance Wilde described pains, exhaustion and partial facial paralysis, symptoms that are often associated with multiple sclerosis.
abstract: In roughly 130 pieces of correspondence to her brother, Constance Wilde described pains, exhaustion and partial facial paralysis, symptoms that are often associated with multiple sclerosis.

headline.main: Private Letters Untangle Mysterious Death of Oscar Wilde's Wife
